summary: This is an email chain from December 12, 2019, showing internal FBI communications regarding a journalist's inquiry about a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who claimed on Twitter that the FBI was investigating a credible death threat against her. The FBI response is 'No comment on any aspect of matters related to Epstein.'

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: James Beal, a journalist for The Sun, emails the FBI asking for comment on a claim made by a victim of Jeffrey Epstein on Twitter regarding an FBI investigation into a death threat against her.

events.title: Journalist inquiry about Epstein victim death threat claim
events.description: Journalist James Beal contacts the FBI seeking comment on a claim made by a victim of Jeffrey Epstein on Twitter that the FBI is investigating a credible death threat against her.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein claimed on Twitter in December 2019 that the FBI was investigating a credible death threat against her.
Journalist James Beal of The Sun contacted the FBI for comment on this claim.
The FBI's internal response, as shown in the email chain, was 'No comment on any aspect of matters related to Epstein.'
The document is an internal FBI email chain, indicating the FBI was aware of the public claim regarding a threat against an Epstein victim.
The email headers show multiple FBI personnel were copied on the correspondence, though their names are redacted.
